thread.title: Top Texas Democrats join Clinton for president `leadership council’
thread.title_full: Top Texas Democrats join Clinton for president `leadership council’

author: Jonathan Tilove
title: Top Texas Democrats join Clinton for president `leadership council’
text:
Top Texas Democrats join Clinton for president `leadership council’ 11:25 a.m. Monday, Oct. 19,   Comments 0 ﻿ 
Hillary Clinton’s presidential campaign Monday announced the formation of a Hillary for Texas Leadership Council including former state Sens. Wendy Davis and Leticia Van de Putte, who were the party’s candidates for governor and lieutenant governor in 2014, eight of the 11 Democratic members of the Texas congressional delegation, and many top Democratic elected officials from Austin. 
State Sen. Kirk Watson and state Reps. Donna Howard, Elliott Naishtat, Eddie Rodriguez and Celia Israel are all members of the council, as are Travis County Judge Sarah Eckhardt and Austin City Council Members Delia Garza, Ann Kitchen, Leslie Pool and Kathie Tovo, and Austin ISD Board of Trustees President Gina Hinojosa, as well as Bastrop City Council Member Dock Jackson. 
The list also includes long-time Clinton hands and confidantes in former Land Commissioner Garry Mauro, GSD&M executives Roy Spence and Judy Trabulsi, and former HUD Secretary Henry Cisneros. Hillary Clinton poster at October 15 rally in San Antonio. 
According to the campaign, the council “will help build a grassroots-driven volunteer team that will help Hillary to win the Texas Primary on March 1.” 
“I continue to be impressed with the depth and breadth of Hillary Clinton’s knowledge, expertise and insights regarding both domestic and international issues,” Howard said in a statement released by the campaign. “Her competence and collaborative approach to crafting policies and solutions that are in the best interests of all Americans make her the best choice for president of the United States. And it’s icing on the cake that she will be the first woman to hold that office, ushering in a new era for my daughters and all women in this great country.” 
Houston Mayor Annise Parker and former Houston Mayor Bill White are also on the council. 
San Antonio Mayor Ivy Taylor was also on the list but her spokeswoman said her office is non-partisan and she will be not making an endorsement, and the Clinton campaign agreed her name should be removed from the list. 
Here is the full list: 
· US Representative Joaquín Castro
